data.title: Joyalukkas on LinkedIn: Our Chairman & MD, Mr. Joy Alukkas is speaking at the industry Talk Series…
data.meta_description: Our Chairman & MD, Mr. Joy Alukkas is speaking at the industry Talk Series 03- Dubai. He will be speaking on Evolution & Innovation of the Jewellery Industry…
data.text:
💡 𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕 #𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒊𝒈𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝒉𝒆𝒂𝒍𝒕𝒉 𝒎𝒂𝒏𝒂𝒈𝒆𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝒉𝒂𝒔 𝒕𝒐 𝒅𝒐 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝒐𝒍𝒅 𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒖𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒂𝒍 𝒎𝒂𝒄𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒆𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒉𝒐𝒘 𝒊𝒕 𝒄𝒂𝒏 𝒔𝒊𝒈𝒏𝒊𝒇𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒚 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅 𝒕𝒉𝒆 #LIFETIME 📈 of 𝒐𝒍𝒅𝒆𝒓 𝒎𝒂𝒄𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒆𝒔. 📍 The #innovation team of #Harburg welding experts Harms & Wende GmbH & Co. KG developed it in cooperation with the #RECLAIM team. #Refurbishment through #digitalization is the keyword. They have #retrofitted their friction welding head with various #sensors to record pressure, temperature, angle, and speed. These now provide valuable #data on the health of the machine for the first time. This makes real #sustainable #maintenance possible for the first time, which not only influences the service life. 𝐌𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐯𝐢𝐝𝐞𝐨. 👉 𝐈𝐟 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐰𝐨𝐮𝐥𝐝 𝐥𝐢𝐤𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐝𝐢𝐬𝐜𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐬𝐞 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐨𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫 𝐯𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐫𝐲 𝐝𝐢𝐠𝐢𝐭𝐚𝐥 𝐬𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐫𝐞𝐟𝐮𝐫𝐛𝐢𝐬𝐡𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭, 𝐫𝐞𝐠𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐧𝐨𝐰 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐋𝐈𝐕𝐄-𝐒𝐓𝐑𝐄𝐀𝐌𝐈𝐍𝐆 𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐨𝐧 𝟐𝟔 𝐒𝐞𝐩𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐞𝐫 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟑: https://lnkd.in/eeQmjUDF #circulareconomy #industry40 Michael Peschl Dietmar Zettel TECNALIA Research & Innovation ESCI - European Science Communication Institute Aston University Centre for Research & Technology Hellas (CERTH) Scuola universitaria professionale della Svizzera italiana (SUPSI) Gorenje Group inc Scm Group Future Intelligence Ltd European Commission Fiercely Information Catalyst Podiumindustries SA European Health and Digital Executive Agency (HaDEA) FLUCHOS LINKS Foundation advanticsys Footwear Technology Center of La Rioja (CTCR) UNI Ente Italiano di Normazione TTS -Technology Transfer System Adriano Ferrara Cristina Di Maria Melanie Gralow Oscar Garcia Perales Lucrezia Maria Quarato Asia Savino Eliseu Pereira Cesar Marin Yuchun Xu Elena Mocchio Edy Bernasconi Jose J de las Heras Kosmas Alexopoulos Level-Up EU Project

Despite its reluctance to change, the jewelry industry should look to technological solutions so that its supply chain can keep pace with changes in the economic landscape and consumer preferences and behavior. Read the full article: Digitization of the Supply Chain ▸ Link in comment

Consumers of luxury products are becoming increasingly concerned with the ethics and sustainability of these products. As a result, the lab-grown diamond industry, valued at $19.3 billion in 2020, is expected to grow to nearly $50 billion by 2030, according to Allied Market Research. While the industry currently produces nearly equal numbers of CVD and HPHT diamonds today, the CVD method will become the preferred method of diamond growth in the next decade as it is less costly and more energy-efficient than HPHT, which requires larger equipment and higher temperatures and pressures. As the public receives more education on lab-grown diamonds, the method by which a diamond is grown may become a factor in a consumer’s decision-making process. The Future of Diamond and Jewelry Manufacturing: Trends and Predictions ▸ Link in comment

Register now for our upcoming webinar 'Funding for Innovation & Implementing new technologies' with Tony Boon from Luxury Lockstitch UK, the KTP team at De Montfort University and Sue Rainton from University of Leeds and Future Fashion Factory Our latest webinar in the Disrupting Manufacturing series will delve into crucial topics shaping the UK's funding landscape and how UK fashion and textile manufacturing businesses can leverage these opportunities for growth and innovation. 📅 26 March 2024, 10:30am-12:00pm 📍 Online The session will cover: → The UK’s funding landscape for manufacturers, innovators and pioneers to explore the mechanisms available to support your initiatives and projects including some of the funding, programmes and grants available. → How businesses can access funding for innovation development, including key strategies and best practices of how to maximise your chances of securing financial support. → How working in partnership with academic institutions can drive innovation and implementation forward. → How funding can unlock potential for increased competitive advantage and foster sustainable growth. UKFT members can email info@ukft.org to register for free. You can register here: https://lnkd.in/exqjwM9n #innovation #manufacturing #fashion #textiles

Despite its reluctance to change, the jewelry industry should look to technological solutions so that its supply chain can keep pace with changes in the economic landscape and consumer preferences and behavior. Read the full article: Digitization of the Supply Chain ▸ Link in comment

On's Light Spray innovation has me thinking. How did a company 50% the size of Under Armour, 25% the size of Puma and 5% of Nike come up with something new and seemingly better than larger and more established competition? How does a risk mindset of a challenger brand stimulate innovation? What roles does company culture have in being open to innovation? How does "accepting risk" growth innovation opportunites? I don't have the answers for all these but have to say this innovation has me thinking differently about the brand. Having the idea is easy. Executing and making it real is hard. I respect On taking the risk. https://lnkd.in/gQM8CQBn --- I’m the owner of The Directive Collective footwear design consultancy. We make great footwear, not just great sketches. #design #footwear #footweardesign
